data.text:
Move over Halloween, it’s beginning to look a lot like Christmas!

That’s right, Hallmark Channel is back with 40 original movies airing during the Countdown to Christmas and Hallmark Movies & Mysteries’ Miracles of Christmas events starting on October 20. The lineup includes fan favorite sequels, beloved stars, wonderful movie locations, reunions with iconic talent, and joyful rom-coms. New movies will air every Friday through Sunday at 8 pm on Hallmark Channel and every Thursday (and Wednesday during Thanksgiving Week) at the same time on Hallmark Movies & Mysteries. Here’s the full lineup of Christmas movies to get you in the holiday spirit.

Checkin’ It Twice

Starring Kim Matula and Kevin McGarry, Checkin’ It Twice follows a journeyman hockey player (McGarry) who falls for a real estate agent (Matula) in a career crisis when he’s traded to her hometown and moves into the cottage in her hockey loving family’s backyard.

Checkin’ It Twice kicks off Hallmark Channel’s Countdown to Christmas on October 20.

Where Are You, Christmas?

Where Are You, Christmas? starring Lyndsy Fonseca, Michael Rady, Jim O’Heir, and Julie Warner, shows what happens when Addy (Fonseca) wishes for a year without Christmas. As she wakes up in a world of black and white, she must work together with the town mechanic (Rady) to restore Christmas.

The film premieres October 21 on Hallmark Channel.

Under The Christmas Sky

In Under the Christmas Sky, an astrophysicist is scheduled for her first trip into space next year until an accident grounds her. As her dreams of being an astronaut dwindle, she is paired up with by-the-book David to work on an exhibit opening right before Christmas. Will the stars align to bring these two together at the holidays? Jessica Parker Kennedy and Ryan Paevey star.

Under the Christmas Sky hits Hallmark Channel on October 22.

Juniper travels to Mystic, Connecticut during the holidays to work at the rehabilitation center and aquarium in Mystic Christmas. While there, she reconnects with Sawyer, the owner of a pizza shop. Jessy Schram, Chandler Massey, Patti Murin, and William R. Moses round out the cast.

Mystic Christmas premieres October 28 on Hallmark Channel — and look out for Pop Culture Planet’s exclusive coverage from the set of the film!

My Christmas Guide follows the life of a college professor after losing his eyesight. He adopts a seeing eye dog from a guide dog trainer. As they all begin to spend time together, his confidence returns and his heart begins to open. Amber Marshall and Ben Mehl lead.

The film hits Hallmark Movies & Mysteries on November 2.

Besties Naomi and Liz reunite with their long-lost flame from high school Chris Silver in Never Been Chris’d. But little do they know that this reunion will ignite a tangled web of love interests, leading them to reflect on their own lives while rediscovering the true worth of companionship. Janel Parrish, Pascal Lamothe-Kipnes, and Tyler Hynes star.

Never Been Chris’d debuts on Hallmark Channel on November 4.

Three friends decide to go to The Santa Summit, a yearly event where people dress up as Santas and have fun in different parts of town. Jordin wants to have fun after a recent breakup, Ava hopes to see someone she likes, and Stella doesn't care about the event at all.. As they continue with their adventures throughout the night, amidst all the chaos and celebrations with lots of Santas around them, they each find what they were looking for: Christmas spirit, potential romance, and a stronger friendship bond between themselves. Hunter King and Benjamin Hollingsworth lead.

The Santa Summit premieres on Hallmark channel on November 5.

In Everything Christmas, two roommates go on a road trip to Yuletide Springs, where Christmas is celebrated all year. On their journey, they meet two guys and enjoy small-town Christmas activities together. When their plans don’t go as expect, a little Christmas magic may turn everything around. Katherine Barrell, Cindy Busby, Corey Sevier, and Matt Wells star.

Everything Christmas hits Hallmark Channel on November 10.

Nikki DeLoach, Lucas Bryant, and Aias Dalman lead A World Record Christmas, which follows the story of a family supporting their autistic son who is determined to set a Guinness World Record by stacking 1400 Jenga blocks. In the spirit of the holiday, they organize a fundraiser to give townspeople an opportunity to donate and decorate a Jenga block, with the proceeds going to benefit kids with autism. Charlie’s journey to setting the Jenga world record gives them all the chance to learn more not just about themselves, but about what family really means.

A World Record Christmas hits Hallmark Movies & Mysteries on November 16.

A Season for Family

In A Season for Family, starring Brendan Penny, Stacey Farber, Benjamin Jacobson, and Azriel Dalman, Maddy's (Farber) adopted son Wesley (Jacobson) who has just one Christmas wish -- to meet his brother Cody (Dalman), who was adopted into a different family.

Cody’s widowed father Paul (Penny) is not ready to have this conversation with his son, so he turns down a meeting. However, circumstances bring the two brothers unknowingly together and they become fast friends, while sparks fly between Maddy and Paul.

A Season for Family launches November 22.

Catch Me If You Claus

Catch Me If You Claus, starring Italia Ricci and Luke Macfarlane, shows Avery Quinn (Ricci), a hopeful news anchor, about to have her major opportunity on the Christmas morning newscast of her station. However, things take an unexpected turn when she discovers an intruder in her house dressed as Santa Claus and claiming to be Chris (Macfarlane), Santa's son embarking on his initial mission.

This triggers a night full of excitement as they are chased by both law enforcement and questionable individuals. Throughout their journey, they bond over the challenges of living under their parents' legacies and motivate one another to pursue their aspirations.

Catch Me If You Claus arrives on November 23.

Letters to Santa, starring Katie Leclerc and Rafael de la Fuente, show young siblings who receive a magical pen by Santa that seems to be able to grant wishes. They use this opportunity to ask for the one thing they desire most - for their parents, who are separated (Leclerc and de la Fuente), to get back together during Christmas.

Letters to Santa hits the Hallmark Channel November 24 on 6 p.m. ET/PT.

Holiday Road

Holiday Road, starring Sara Canning and Warren Christie, tells the story about a group of individuals from different backgrounds find themselves stranded at the airport due to bad weather. Among them are a tech entrepreneur (Christie), travel writer (Canning), devoted mother Enid-Raye Adams and her son Kiefer O'Reilly, stubborn senior Trevor Lerner, enigmatic woman Brittany Willacy with an air of mystery surrounding her presence, couple Sharon Crandall and Ryan Mah who were traveling from Hong Kong, and social media influencer Princess Davis.

In order to reach Denver despite their circumstances, the group decides to rent a shared van and embark on an unexpected road trip together. Bound by unforeseen adventures along the way, this journey brings them closer as they form meaningful connections that have potential to alter each individual's life trajectory. The story is inspired by true events.

Witness their journey in Holiday Road on November 24.

A well-known soccer player, Graham Savoy (Moseley), who constantly has a packed schedule that leaves no room for romance. However, during his Christmas visit to Notting Hill, he has a change of heart after encountering Georgia (Ramos) - an American visitor who is blissfully unaware of his celebrity status.

Keep an eye out for these lovebirds in Christmas in Notting Hill, starring Sarah Ramos and William Moseley, on November 25 at 6 p.m. ET/PT.

Haul Out the Holly: Lit Up, starring Lacey Chabert, Wes Brown, Stephen Tobolowsky, Melissa Peterman, Ellen Travolta, Seth Morris, and Jennifer Aspen, shows Emily (Chabert) and Jared (Brown) excited to celebrate together as a couple. Emily is embracing her community's festive spirit on Evergreen Lane and is ready to work with their friends Ned (Tobolowsky), Mary Louise (Travolta), and Pamela (Peterman) to make this year's Christmas celebrations even better.

However, being the girlfriend of the HOA president doesn't exempt them from decorating citations. The sale of a house in their neighborhood causes excitement among residents when they discover that the new neighbors are holiday royalty Morris and Aspen. It seems like this year's competition for best decorations will be intense with their arrival.

Decorate your home with Haul Out the Holly: Lit Up on November 25.

Our Christmas Mural

Follow single mother Olivia coming back to her hometown during Christmas season. Unbeknownst to her, her mother decides to secretly submit Olivia's name for a mural competition. Surprisingly enough, she emerges as the winner of this contest but ends up teaming up with Will- an educator - in order to craft a remarkable piece of art that embraces the holiday spirit. Alex Paxton-Beesley and Dan Jeannotte lead.

Paint the town with Christmas cheer with Our Christmas Mural on November 26 at 6 p.m. ET/PT.

Lucy Hardgrove, a screenwriter who lands the job of a lifetime when she’s hired to pen the script for a remake of the beloved, holiday movie classic, His Merry Wife!, which was filmed in 1947 at beautiful, historic Biltmore House. Bethany Joy Lenz, Kristoffer Polaha, Jonathan Frakes, and Robert Picardo star in the film.

When the head of the studio isn’t satisfied with the ending Lucy (Lenz) wrote because it deviates from the original’s feel-good conclusion, he sends Lucy to Biltmore Estate for research and inspiration.

While there, she unwittingly discovers the ability to travel to the 1947 set of His Merry Wife! through the help of an hourglass. While on set, she and Jack Huston (Polaha) spend time together and become close. However, her sudden appearance has set off a chain of events that put the production in jeopardy. Before she can return to the present, Lucy must make things right or threaten to alter the future forever.

Follow her adventure with Biltmore Christmas on November 26.

Three Wise Men and a Baby–EXTENDED CUT,” starring Paul Campbell, Tyler Hynes, Andrew Walker, and Margaret Colin, is a never-before-seen extended cut exclusive to Hallmark Movies Now. The film is about three brothers (Campbell, Hynes, Walker) getting the surprise of their lives when they are forced to work together to care for a baby over the holidays. As they slowly get the hang of things, they find themselves on unexpected journeys of self-discovery and begin to rebuild their relationships as brothers, as well as the damaged romantic and professional relationships in their respective lives…all while rediscovering their love of Christmas.

Join the crazy ride with Three Wise Men and a Baby on November 27.

Time for Her to Come Home for Christmas, starring Shenae Grimes-Beech, Chris Carmack, and Grace Leer, shows Carly (Grimes-Beech) facing her first Christmas without her mother and looking to avoid loneliness as she heads to a quaint town to lead the church choir at Christmas.

Once there, Carly meets Matthew (Carmack), a man back in town after serving in the army. As she gets to know Matthew, the choir and townspeople, she stumbles across clues that suggest she may have been brought here for a life changing reason. As the mystery unravels one thing is clear, this journey will teach Carly about true love, learning to trust, and that forgiveness is needed to finally heal.

Time for Her to Come Home for Christmas premieres on November 30 or November 16 for Hallmark Movies Now subscribers.

My Norwegian Holiday

Join Rhiannon Fish and David Elsendoorn in the heartwarming tale of My Norwegian Holiday!

In this delightful film, we follow JJ (Fish) as she navigates through the loss of her beloved grandmother and searches for inspiration for her dissertation. But little does she know, her life is about to take an unexpected turn when she meets Henrik (played by David Elsendoorn), a charming Norwegian from Bergen.

Their connection blossoms when Henrik discovers that JJ owns a troll figurine from his hometown. Intrigued by the troll's history and eager to uncover her grandmother's ties, JJ agrees to embark on a magical journey to Norway with Henrik. Together, they venture into the enchanting city of Bergen, immersing themselves in Henrik's family Christmas and wedding traditions. And guess what? His sister's wedding is even happening on Christmas Eve!

As JJ dives deeper into this holiday adventure, she unravels the fascinating origins of the troll and, more importantly, discovers her own path to healing, love, and the true meaning of family.

So mark your calendars for December 1 and get ready to travel to Norway with My Norwegian Holiday.

A Not So Royal Christmas

Get ready to enjoy A Not So Royal Christmas, featuring Brooke D’Orsay and Will Kemp. Charlotte, a tabloid journalist, is on a mission to interview a Count who's been hiding away for years. But when the royal family sends a groundskeeper to pose as the Count, things get interesting.

Uncover the mystery on A Not So Royal Christmas airing on December 2.

To All a Good Night

Follow a small-town photographer as she saves the life of a mysterious man, who may just be in town to buy her family’s parkland - which is also the location of the annual Christmas celebration. Kimberley Sustad and Mark Ghanimé star in the film.

To All a Good Night premieres on December 7.

Rescuing Christmas

In a world where Santa is real and wants to drum up some holiday spirit, two elves, Chuck and Debbie, devise a plan to grant one human on Earth three wishes to kickstart the holidays.

Unfortunately, that human is Erin (Cook), who has lost all affection for the season. Even a blind date with the affable and charming Sam (Page) won’t change her mind about Christmas. When she makes the mistake of wishing Christmas would “just disappear,” Erin wakes up to a world where the holiday never existed!

She realizes that she’s taken away everyone’s joy, so she enlists Sam to help her reinvent the festivities from scratch. In the process, Erin learns just how much this holiday and its traditions have meant to everyone around her — and how much Sam has come to mean to her.

Rescuing Christmas, starring Rachael Leigh Cook and Sam Page, hits exclusively on Hallmark Movies Now on December 7.

Round and Round, starring Vic Michaelis, Bryan Greenberg, and Rick Hoffman, is about Rachel (Michaelis) stuck in a time loop, reliving the night of her parents’ Hanukkah party. Can Zach (Greenberg), the “nice boy” Grandma’s trying to set her up with, help her make it to tomorrow?

Find out with Round and Round on December 10.

Heaven Down Here, starring Krystal Joy Brown, Tina Lifford, Juan Riedinger, Richard Harmon, and Phylicia Rashad, ” tells the story of four disparate people who find themselves stranded in a local diner on Christmas Eve when a snowstorm hits the town. Widowed mother of two Imami (Brown) struggles making ends meet and reluctantly agrees to work the Christmas Eve shift, where she clashes with her boss Dan (Harmon), who doesn’t exactly embody the Christmas spirit.

Felix (Riedinger) is a local pastor desperately trying to secure food for parishioners while his faith is challenged by his alienation by his son. Clara (Lifford) is a hospice nurse with an obstinate patient (Rashad) and whose daughter is moving away, causing her to question her place in this world. Throughout the evening, these four bicker, bond and unwittingly provide each other with the answer to their respective prayers.

Hear their stories with Heaven Down Here on December 14.

An Ice Palace Romance, starring Celeste Desjardins and Marcus Rosner, follows the story of a journalist (Desjardins) facing her old fears when she returns to her hometown ice rink to cover a story. With the help of the owner (Rosner) and his young daughter, she begins to reevaluate her life’s purpose. Exclusive on Hallmark Movies Now.

Put on your skating shoes with An Ice Palace Romance, exclusively on Hallmark Movies Now on December 14.

The Secret Gift of Christmas

The Secret Gift of Christmas (wt), starring Meghan Ory and Christopher Russell, focuses on personal shopper Bonnie (Ory) who helps her new, widowed client Patrick (Russell) reconnect with his young daughter. Though Bonnie and Patrick’s ideas of shopping couldn’t be any more different, she is determined to get Patrick and his daughter everything on their wish list.

See if Bonnie can complete her task with The Secret Gift of Christmas on December 15.

Sealed with a List

Sealed with a List, starring Katie Findlay and Evan Roderick, shows festive Carley (Findlay) as she sets out to conquer her list of abandoned resolutions from last year. Aided by coworker Wyatt (Roderick), she finds love and the confidence to chase her dreams.

Get your resolutions out with Sealed with A List on December 16.

Friends & Family Christmas

Friends & Family Christmas, starring Humberly Gonzalez and Ali Liebert, is a story about Daniella (Gonzalez) in New York where she’s pursuing an art career and staying for Christmas with her circle of artist friends, instead of going home to see her parents. A talented entertainment lawyer Amelia (Liebert) is trying to stay focused on her work after a broken engagement.

When Daniella and Amelia are set up by their parents, they agree to pretend that they are dating, to appease them for the holidays. However, as they spend time in each other’s worlds, they soon build a connection that is deeper than either of them could have hoped for.

Grab your loved ones for Friends & Family Christmas on December 17.

Miracle in Bethlehem, PA

Miracle in Bethlehem, PA, starring Laura Vandervoort and Benjamin Ayres, portrays Mary Ann Brubeck (Vandervoort), a successful and fiercely independent woman, as she adopts a baby girl to raise on her own just before Christmas.

Due to the weather, Mary and the baby are forced to spend the Christmas in Bethlehem, PA, where her only alternative is to stay with the innkeeper's brother Joe (Ayres), a classic bachelor who lives in a house he treats like a barn. Joe begins to get his act together with fresh purpose as Mary Ann learns the value of community by spending time with Joe's family and participating in the local church's Christmas celebrations...and the two start to see one other in a different way.

Miracle in Bethlehem, PA debuts on December 21.

A Holiday Spectacular–EXTENDED CUT, starring Ginna Claire Mason, Derek Klena, Eve Plumb, Ann Margret, and featuring the Radio City Rockettes, is set in 1958 where Maggie (Mason) is an heiress from Philadelphia who puts her high-society wedding plans on hold in order to sneak up to New York City and make her secret dream come true: dancing live on stage in the Christmas Spectacular at Radio City Music Hall.

Get up and dance with A Holiday Spectacular Extended Cut, closing out Hallmark’s Countdown to Christmas on December 21, exclusively on Hallmark Movies Now.
